Here, there and some of  RStudio’s introductory primers. You can do these in your web browser, type code and see the results there.

You’ll learn some of the basics of R, as well as some methods for manipulating data with the dplyr package.

Complete these:

## The Basics 
* [Data Visualization Basics](https://posit.cloud/learn/primers/1.1)
  
* [Programming basics](https://posit.cloud/learn/primers/1.2)

## Work with Data
* [Working with Tibbles](https://posit.cloud/learn/primers/2.1)

* [Isolating Data with dplyr](https://posit.cloud/learn/primers/2.2)

* [Deriving Information with](dplyr https://posit.cloud/learn/primers/2.3)

The content from these primers comes from the (free and online!) book R for Data Science by Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham. This is a great book as a reference and for continuing to learn and use R in the future.
